stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.

Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.

preGame:
Hello, hello, hello, fans and fiends! This is Nok the Corrupter, your voice of the void, broadcasting live from the rustic, bone-crunching beauty of Fletchings Field! üå≥üí• It‚Äôs a swell day for a slaughter in the Winners Bracket! We‚Äôre heading into Game Two of this Best of 3 series, and the atmosphere is thicker than a swamp troll‚Äôs neck! The local Warden fans have turned out in droves, hooting and hollering for their beloved Oak & Onslaught. Meanwhile, the Haven Lights look a bit pale‚Äîmaybe it‚Äôs the lack of incense, or maybe it‚Äôs the fact that they‚Äôre one loss away from the losers' bracket! 

Look at the field, folks! The local druids have been busy, and the terrain is shifting under the players' boots as we speak. I saw Wynnie Faina and Normi Glaudia of the Onslaught doing their warm-ups with their boots on the wrong feet‚Äîa classic Warden tactic to confuse the ankles, I suppose! On the other side, the Haven Lights are up to their usual nonsense. Dickenson Beker is currently trying to teach a stray dog how to play dead‚Äîhardly necessary when the Onslaught is about to do it for him! 

It‚Äôs a playoff atmosphere like no other! Sir Randy is somewhere in the rafters with that fancy bow of his, probably looking for a clean shot, while the common folk are lining up for the open bar. With a series lead of 1-0, the Onslaught are looking to close this out and send the 'shining champions' of Haven packing. Will the Lights find their spark, or will they be extinguished in the gullies of Fletchings? Let's get to the carnage! üèÜüçª
postGame:
Hold onto your hats, folks, because that was a humdinger of a game that nearly shook the Demon Prison itself! üèÅ Oak & Onslaught have clinched the series 2-0 with a heart-stopping 4-3 victory in overtime! The drama! The blood! The sheer, unadulterated chaos! It was enough to make even a demon shed a tear of joy. Those Haven Lights fought like cornered rats, but in the end, the Warden muscle proved too much for the 'holy' crowd. 

The match ignited in the Away Field where Ema Ulrick scooped up the troll head and fired a rocket for an early score! It was a beautiful opening, though the Haven Lights didn't let the lead last long. Dickenson Beker, after a morning of failed dog training, showed she knows her way around an end zone, dunking the ball to tie it up! The crowd was absolutely roaring, and the ale was flowing so fast I'm surprised anyone could see the ball! 

Speaking of the ale, you could tell the Wardens were feeling that high alcohol tolerance! Wynnie Faina was charging around with the grace of a drunken centaur, eventually dunking the ball to keep the Onslaught in the hunt. The stadium's shifting terrain was a real hoot‚Äîevery time a Haven player tried to get their bearings, a gully seemed to open up right beneath them! Sir Randy must have been laughing his feathered cap off from the sidelines. 

The violence was, quite frankly, exquisite. Teria Ravo decided Marlane Lounge had seen enough of the game and sent them to the healer with a crunch that echoed through the monastery! But the Lights wouldn't stay down. Coward Tarton showed some genuine grit, firing a shot from center field to keep the score tight. It was a back-and-forth struggle that would make Sir Artorias the Moonslayer look like he was playing a game of hopscotch! 

As we headed into overtime, the tension was high enough to snap a dragon's tendon. Both teams took their breaks to let the healers work their magic‚ÄîRiffle Harrington was working overtime Tying laces and mending faces! But once the whistle blew, it was pure carnage. Milt Casady and Hole Bowerman were taken out of the equation early, leaving the Onslaught looking a bit thin on the ground. 

Riffle Heyde was a one-man wrecking crew for the Lights, tackling Milt Casady and Symer Crissy into the dirt! I haven't seen that much righteous fury since the last time someone told Sir Tanos he was being too bold. It looked like the Lights might actually force a Game Three, keeping their flickering hopes alive in this Winners Bracket clash. 

But then, the shifting terrain of Fletchings Field played its hand! Wieren Ivar managed to flatten Hole Bowerman, but the distraction allowed Abner Seidel to slip through the defense. Abner, wearing those garishly colored undergarments for luck, showed more heart than a whole legion of temple guards! He dodged the tackles, ignored the screams of the fallen, and charged for the goal. 

The final play was a masterpiece of Warden grit. Abner Seidel didn't just walk into the end zone; he soared like a griffin over a carcass! He dunked that leather troll head home, ending the game and the series in one glorious motion. The Warden fans went absolutely wild, probably spilling enough beer to fill a moat! 

It‚Äôs a 2-0 sweep for Oak & Onslaught! They move forward in the Winners Bracket, while the Haven Lights are sent down to the Losers' Bracket to contemplate their 'virtues.' Perhaps they should spend less time on their night vision roots and more time learning how to block a charging Warden! 

The popularity of the Onslaught is soaring, and rightfully so! They play with the kind of reckless abandon that makes Trollball the greatest sport in all of Osterra. The fans are already chanting Abner's name, though I suspect he's mostly just happy his lucky drawers stayed intact! 

So, as the sun sets over Fletchings Field and the healers start the long process of scraping players off the turf, we bid you a fond farewell! The 'heroes' of Haven have fallen, the Wardens have risen, and the ale has finally run out. What a magnificent day for Trollball! 

This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off! Stay corrupt, stay violent, and we'll see you for the next round of playoff insanity! Goodnight, Osterra! üíÄüçªüèÜ
